channel.title: Members on XiaoLab
channel.description: Recent content in Members on XiaoLab

item.title: Member 1
item.description: I am a Associate Professor in School of Basic Medical Sciences at Xi’an Jiaotong University. Prior to joining XJTU, I completed my Ph.D. in Xuerui Yang’s lab at Tsinghua University, where I studied the gene dysregulations of cancers at both transcriptional and translational levels based on high-throughput sequencing techniques. Then, I worked as a postdoctoral associate in Jason Locasale’s Lab at Duke University, studying cancer metabolism and tumor microenvironment at single cell resolution.

item.title: Member 2
item.description: I am an Assistant Professor in School of Basic Medical Sciences at Xi’an Jiaotong University. Before joining XJTU, I completed my Ph.D. in Zhangsheng Yu’s lab at Shanghai Jiao Tong University, where I developed method for rare cell type identification and subtyping of HCC (hepatocellular carcinoma) using (sc)RNA-seq transcriptome.

item.title: Member 3
item.description: I am a Assistant Professor in School of Basic Medical Sciences at Xi’an Jiaotong University. I completed my Ph.D. at Northwest A&F University, where I mainly engaged in single-cell tumor microenvironment analysis and computer-aided drug development. The main focus of my work is to understand the resistance mechanisms of immune checkpoint blockade therapy and to develop a synergistic combination strategy for tumor treatment.

item.title: Member 4
item.description: I am the research assistant of Associate Professor Zhengtao Xiao’s research group in Xi ‘an Jiaotong University School of Basic Medicine. Before joining Xi ‘an Jiaotong University, I completed my master’s degree in Nanjing Normal University. After one year of work, I joined Associate Professor Zhengtao Xiao’s to study metabolism and tumor microenvironment at single cell resolution.

item.title: Member 5
item.description: I am a direct doctoral student in Mr. Xiao’s research group. I graduated from Northwest A&F University with a bachelor’s degree. in 2022，I joined the laboratory and carried out research on bioinformatics and tumor metabolism.

item.title: Member 6
item.description: I am a master student in Mr. Xiao’s research group. I graduated from Xi’an Jiaotong University with a bachelor’s degree. in 2021, I joined the laboratory and carried out research on bioinformatics and tumor metabolism.

item.title: member 7
item.description: I am a 2022 graduate student in School of Basic Medical Sciences at Xi ‘an Jiaotong University. I graduated from Dalian Medical University with a bachelor’s degree in preventive medicine, during which I learned biostatistics, epidemiology and other professional courses. In this summer vacation, I taught myself R language, RNA-seq analysis and other bioinformatics skills.

item.title: Member 8
item.description: I am a master student learning bioinformatics in Dr.Xiao’s research group. I joined the lab and carried out my research on bioinformatics and tumor metabolism.

item.title: Member 9
item.description: I am a master student learning bioinformatics in Dr.Xiao’s research group. I graduated from Xi’an Jiaotong University with a bachelor’s degree in 2021. Then, I joined the lab and carried out my research on bioinformatics and tumor metabolism.

item.title: Member 91
item.description: I am a graduate student of Life Science College of Life Science at Northwest Normal University. Currently, I am learning how to screen anti-tumor compounds by network pharmacology from the laboratory of Professor Zhengtao Xiao of Basic Medical Sciences of Xi ‘an Jiaotong University.

item.title: Member
item.description: I am a master student learning bioinformatics in Dr.Xiao’s research group. I graduated from Xi’an Jiaotong University with a bachelor’s degree in 2021. Then, I joined the lab and carried out my research on bioinformatics and tumor metabolism.
